urls.title: Avgeek Alert: Deciphering Airport Runway Markings - Me gusta volar
urls.description: As with roads for cars, trucks, and motorcycles, airport runways have their own special markings, some obvious, some not - so here's a little primer!

data.text: We end with an easy one: a discontinuous line that identifies the central axis to provide alignment guidance for the aircraft. 🤔 Discover the nine types of runway markings and how aircraft move on the ground. ✈️ (4/4) https://t.co/9FIymMkOO7

Now one with numbers! It indicates the first two digits of the degrees of orientation of the runway with respect to the magnetic north: 25. If there are parallel runways, the letter R refers to the right and the letter L to the left. We're referring to: (3/4)
If they indicate the start of the runway where the pilot can land and look like a zebra crossing, we're talking about: 👀 (2/4)

You probably already know this but... 🤔 Just like roads, airports have markings and signs to organise the traffic. ✈️ The ones you see painted on the runway are known as horizontal signs or runway markings. How many types can you guess? ⬇️ (1/4) https://t.co/VoBG6nkMlH

urls.title: Presurización en los aviones: ¿por qué es necesaria?
urls.description: ¿Has notado los oídos taponados durante un vuelo? Se debe a la presurización en los aviones. Así funciona este mecanismo perfecto.

data.text:
We explain how pressurisation works and why it's so important👉🏼https://t.co/JiOIVNdN3W 
(3/3)

It's because of the difference in pressure between the air in the middle ear and the air outside caused by the change in altitude. ✈️ To be able to fly so high, a process is carried out in the cabin known as... (2/3)
Ever wondered why you have ringing in your ears at take-off and landing? 🤔 (1/3) https://t.co/BgHkLr65Zs

Which of our planes can fly for up to 20 hours (11,000 km) without stopping to refuel?
Weather conditions are another factor that impacts how long and how far a plane can fly (4/6)
As well as fuel, it also depends on the weight of the plane, which varies according to the number of passengers, cargo, bags and… (3/6)
A plane's autonomy depends on...  (2/6)

Today we’re talking about the factors that influence a plane’s autonomy – in other words, how long and how far it can fly without stopping to refuel. ✈️ Follow the thread (1/6) https://t.co/vF82vhFgPs

Today we celebrate our 95th anniversary!We've come a long way since that first flight, but we continue to work every day with the same enthusiasm and as committed as ever to connecting millions of people, dreams and stories around the world 🎂  #EveryDayIsDayOne #ConnectingPeople https://t.co/ninUayl7XQ

urls.title: The new Iberia in-flight experience | Iberia Plus
urls.description: Paula Lafora, head of customer experience, design and delivery at Iberia

data.text: Paula Lafora, talks about Iberia's latest on-board experience, that has been created just for your enjoyment. Not to be missed 👉https://t.co/49SmhR1o5m https://t.co/CdpmxY3dd5

Today is a historic day. We are launching new uniforms, inaugurating new routes, Washington and Dallas, and restarting flights to San Francisco. And on all three, we operate with biofuel produced from waste from @Repsol.✈️More info at 👇
Today is a very special day for us. Today we fly again with all the excitement of the first day. Press play and discover why ✈! #EveryDayIsDayOne https://t.co/uLrqi3Bdvw

Our uniforms have always been a benchmark for Spanish fashion. And from tomorrow they'll be flying our colours again courtesy of @teresahelbig 🧵 Today, #InternationalFlightAttendantDay, we salute all our cabin crew. Looking forward to seeing you on board! ✈ https://t.co/0ELHoJmbd6
@Visita_Madrid Hola everyone, and the winner is...🥁🥁🥁: Xabi Climent! Thank you all for participating and sharing your memories about Madrid! #MadridinUS

With @Visita_Madrid we are raffling 140K Avios, equivalent to a round trip from the USA to Madrid for 2 people. Tell us your ideal plan in Madrid with the hashtag #MadridinUS. The winner will be announced Wednesday during the presentation of our new #IberiaA350 Hola Madrid.

The beauty of Cuba's seabed is just as extraordinary as anything you will find on the surface. Isla de la Juventud, Cayo Largo del Sur… You will find our selection here 👉 https://t.co/hhkWXQkd5U https://t.co/vqgXS6rGVt
Did you get them all right? Find out more about the lights our planes use to illuminate the sky: https://t.co/BRSg0MB9BV (6/6)
They're part of the checklist before starting the engine. Clue: 🔴🔴 (5/6)
They are turned on when the pilot is going to take off or land. Clue: ⚪️⚪️ (4/6)
They're used on the ground to drive around the correct routes at the airport. Clue: ⚪️✈️ (3/6)
They're used to identify the trajectory and direction of the plane from the ground. Clue: 🔴⚪️🟢 (2/6)
Today we're talking about the importance of the lights on planes. Opening thread (1/6) https://t.co/9gneyHScRM

data.text: Did you know that the Bilbao estuary is 23 km long? It divides Bilbao in two and its banks witnessed the city's regeneration in the 1990s. Today these streets are well worth discovering 🌎 Fancy coming along? 👇https://t.co/D9gEYMp6sJ https://t.co/RQeA7BXZoH

We have more good news! A new contract for our maintenance business to support @qatarairways V2500 engines, which will help us to consolidate our position as a reference maintenance centre in Europe 🔧✈️. 
More info here 👇
